news.title: Secunderabad cantonment board fixes fee for mutation of name in property register
news.para: Property owners will now have to pay 2,000 for mutation of name in property tax register and another Rs 350 as publication fee.

news.title: Uttarakhand land law panel submits report, suggests stricter norms
news.para: The panel, headed by former chief secretary Subash Kumar, in its report recommended stricter land laws in Uttarakhand along the lines of neighbouring Himachal Pradesh.

news.title: Rajkot IT park project delayed over land allotment
news.para: The Rajkot Information Technology Association (RITA) has tasked a private consultant to prepare a detailed project report (DPR) to convince the government agencies about its economic benefits.

news.title: Punjab: Portal launched for NOC for unapproved colonies' properties
news.para: ​​A portal was launched where people can apply for no objection certificates (NOC) of plots and other properties in unapproved colonies.

news.title: Goa: Release of draft construction rules before ODPs worries citizens
news.para: Architect Arminio Ribeiro said that the government should have first prepared the next Regional Plan and notified the Outline Development Plans and only then come up with the draft regulations.

news.title: Most buildings in Lucknow lack emergency exit
news.para: In a reality check of Charbagh, Naka, Shahnajaf road and Hazratganj areas, TOI found that most of the commercial complexes are not equipped with safety equipment like fire alarms, water sprinklers, hose reels, smoke detectors, fire extinguishers and sand buckets.

news.title: Gujarat government approves town planning schemes for Ahmedabad & Surat
news.para: The schemes cleared for Ahmedabad include one final TP scheme, one draft TP scheme, and two preliminary TP schemes. One preliminary TP scheme has been cleared for Surat, the release added.

news.title: Chennai: Consumer court orders Vardhaman Construction to compensate buyer
news.para: Vardhaman Construction and Investment owned by G Sundararajan, sold 586 sqft of undivided share of plot in Ayanavaram for ₹12.95 lakh to Venugopal in 2009.

news.title: Twin towers gone but Supertech Emerald Court's basements beyond 50m still await repair
news.para: But this doesn’t include 12 basement columns where hairline cracks were seen after the demolition of the twin towers on August 28. The Central Building Research Institute (CBRI) will likely be brought in for that, officials said on Monday.

news.title: Tishman Speyer, Ganesh Housing form strategic alliance for SEZ project in Ahmedabad
news.para: “We are pleased to partner with a global leader to help us build sustainable and world class projects for all our clients. We look forward for a long-term collaboration to meet the values and expectations of our customers in future as well,” said Shekhar G Patel, Managing Director, GHCL.

news.title: Property registration to be simpler in Karnataka, faster from November 1
news.para: Revenue minister R Ashoka told reporters on Monday the new software, which is both people- and department-friendly, is being tested at a sub-registrar's office in Chincholi of Kalaburagi district. It will be launched across the state from November 1.

news.title: DTCP bans registry and sale of properties in Palam Vihar
news.para: The residents, who are facing a tough time due to DTCP action, have demanded that restrictions be imposed on properties owned by the developer and not them.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh government approves TOD policy around rapid rail corridor
news.para: In the trans-Hindon areas of Ghaziabad, which are already packed with highrises, the policy will carve out what is called the TOD “influence zone” where vertical development will be encouraged.

news.title: China's Kaisa Group aims to present offshore debt revamp plan in Q4 2022: Sources
news.para: Kaisa is working to restructure its offshore debt after missing some debt obligations last year. With $12 billion of offshore debt, it is China's largest issuer of offshore debt among developers after China Evergrande Group.

news.title: Chennai: Water meters planned in every household in five years
news.para: In the first phase, meters will be fixed in 50,000 commercial establishments, multi-storey buildings, apartment complexes and partly commercial establishments by March 2023. An assessment will be done and a metering policy framed.
